Corteva is a leading global provider of Seed and Crop Protection solutions focused on the agriculture industry . Corteva was incorporated in Delaware in March 2018 and maintains its business headquarters in Indianapolis, Indiana . The company leverages its rich heritage of scientific achievement to advance its robust innovation pipeline and continue to shape the future of agriculture .
 On June 1, 2019, Corteva, Inc. became an independent, publicly traded company through the completed separation (the “Separation”) of the agriculture business of DuPont de Nemours, Inc., formerly known as DowDuPont . The company's broad portfolio of agriculture solutions fuels farmer productivity in approximately 110 countries .
 On April 1, 2019, DowDuPont completed the separation of its materials science business into a separate and independent public company, Dow, Inc. Corteva, Inc.'s common stock began trading on the New York Stock Exchange under the ticker symbol "CTVA" on June 3, 2019 . The separation was completed on May 31, 2019 and on June 1,2019, the Separation was completed .

Agreement sets forth governance of certain aspects of Parties’ ongoing relationships after the completion of their respective separations (the "Corteva Separation Agreement")
 The company’s operations are managed through two reportable segments: Seed and Crop Protection . The Seed segment is a global leader in developing and supplying commercial seed combining advanced germplasm and traits that produce optimum yield for farms around the world . Crop protection supplies products to protect crop yields against weeds, insects and disease, enabling farmers to achieve optimal results .
 The Seed segment’s net sales by major product line and geographic region (based on customer location) are as follows:                                                            Products and Brands  are listed below:                         Seed Solutions Brands; Pioneer®  seeds; Brevant®® seeds; Dairyland Seed®; Hoegemeyer® hybrids; Nutech® brand; Cordius® Licensing Division of Corteva Agriscience, DUO® hybrid corn, NEXSEM® semillas .
 The Seed segment has a diverse worldwide network which markets and distributes the company’s brands to customers, primarily through a multi-channel, multi-brand strategy, which includes four differentiated channels: Pioneer agency model, regional barge model, Pioneer agency and Pioneer Agency model . The company significantly reduced the volume of products with the Roundup Ready 2 Yield® and Roundup Ready . 2 Xtend™ traits beginning in 2021 .
 The Pioneer agency model is unique to Corteva and represents sales made directly to farmers via independent sales representatives . Corteva out-licenses traits and germplasm to third parties through licensing and distribution channels . The company's regional brands connect to customers through regional brand employees and farmer-dealer networks. Retail brands provide a one-stop shop for seed and chemistry solutions .
 Corteva focuses on customer-driven innovation to deliver superior germplasm and trait technologies . The Seed segment's research and development ("R&D") and supply chain groups work seamlessly to select and maintain product characteristics that enhance quality of its seed products and solutions . The Crop Protection segment serves the global agricultural input industry with products that protect against weeds, insects and other pests, and disease .

 Corteva’s sales are generally strongest in the first half of the calendar year, which aligns with the planting and growing season in the northern hemisphere . The company's supply chain strategy involves managing global supplies of active and intermediate ingredients sourced regionally with global best practices and oversight . Corteva's supply strategy includes a robust and flexible global footprint .
 The company’s direct distribution channel, where products are shipped to farmers, is more affected by planting delays than its competitors . Severe unfavorable weather, however, can impact overall sales . The company's strong employee base of approximately 22,000 employees, along with its commitment to its core values, is a key element to the success of its business .
 The company has implemented safety programs and management practices to promote a culture of safety to protect its employees, as well as the environment . The company maintains nine global BRGs, each led by a member of the company’s senior leadership . It monitors its recruitment and talent development processes, in order to prevent and detect inequities and potentially discriminatory practices .
 Corteva considers its intellectual property estate, which includes patents, trade secrets, trademarks and copyrights, to constitute a valuable asset of Corteva . No single patent, trademark, license or group of related patents or licenses is in itself essential to the company as a whole or to any of the company’s segments . The company believes its management team has the experience necessary to effectively execute its strategy .
 Corteva vigilantly protects its intellectual property . At December 31, 2024, the company owned about 5,800 U.S. patents and about 10,600 patents outside of the U.N. Corteva’s rights under these patents and licenses, as well as the products made and sold under them, are important to the company .
 The company competes with producers of seed germplasm, trait developers, and crop protection products on a global basis . Corteva has approximately 1,800 registrations and 1,000 pending trademark applications in a number of jurisdictions . The global market for products within the industry is highly competitive and the company believes competition has and will continue to intensify .

Failure to comply with these regulations or future regulatory bans may materially impact our financial performance . Plant GMOs are regulated by the U.S. Department of Agriculture’s Animal and Plant Health Inspection Service (the “APHIS”) under the Plant Protection Act .
 Pesticides and microorganisms containing GMOs are regulated by the Environmental Protection Agency . The FDA ensures that the food is safe for food and feed . The EPA assesses the trait or stack containing the traits to ensure that there is no unreasonable adverse effect to the environment . Various countries in EMEA, Latin America, and Asia Pacific have banned GMOs entirely .
 The EPA reevaluates pesticide tolerances at least every 10 years, taking into account ecological and human health risks, in addition to cumulative risks as a result of multiple routes and sources of exposure . We rely on the availability of data from the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services to address potential risks to human health .
 The company's European operations are subject to the European chemical regulation REACH (“Regulations, Evaluation, Authorisation, and Restriction of Chemicals”) and the CLP . Other jurisdictions also have rigorous approval processes, procedures and scientific testing requirements for the approval of crop protection products . We continue to monitor legislative and regulatory developments related to pollution and other environmental health and safety matters .
